com.advantage.dbutils

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.advantage.dbutils.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    Prerequisite for MySQL - Installation of mysql and supported version of mysql.jconnector.java. Add mysql.jconnector.java jar file in java project. Provide GRANT ALL permission for all databases.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Database(java.lang.String sServer, int nPort, java.lang.String sDatabaseName)
      Initializes class with Integrated Security Enabled, username/password are set to null
      Database(java.lang.String sServer, java.lang.String sDatabaseName)
      Initializes class with default port, Integrated Security Enabled, username/password are set to null
      Database(java.lang.String sUser, java.lang.String sPassword, java.lang.String sServer, int nPort, java.lang.String sDatabaseName)
      Integrated Security is set based on sUser value
      Database(java.lang.String sUser, java.lang.String sPassword, java.lang.String sServer, java.lang.String sDatabaseName)
      Integrated Security is set based on sUser value and use the default port.

      Note: Recommended to use this constructor.

      • Database

        public Database(java.lang.String sUser,
        java.lang.String sPassword,
        java.lang.String sServer,
        java.lang.String sDatabaseName)
        Integrated Security is set based on sUser value and use the default port.

        Note: Recommended to use this constructor.
        Parameters:
        sUser - - Username to use to connect
        sPassword - - Password to use to connect
        sServer - - DB Server
        sDatabaseName - - Database Name

      • enableIntegratedSecurity

        public void enableIntegratedSecurity()
        Enable Integrated Security. If you use a constructor that sets the username/password, then Integrated Security is disabled by default.

        Note: This required the sqljdbc_auth.dll to be in the java.library.path

      • disableIntegratedSecurity

        public void disableIntegratedSecurity()
        Disable Integrated Security. If you use a constructor that does not specify username/password, then Integrated Security is enabled by default.

      • setIntegratedSecurityBasedOnUserValue

        public void setIntegratedSecurityBasedOnUserValue()
        Sets bIntegratedSecurity to true if sUser is null or empty string else set to false.

      • openConnection

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.sql.Connection con,
                              java.lang.String sQuery)
        Executes the given query. (There is no parameterization with this method. So, query cannot have any parameters.)
        Parameters:
        con - - Connection to DB
        sQuery - - Query to execute
        Returns:
        ResultSet

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.sql.Connection con,
                              java.lang.String sQuery,
                              java.lang.String[] sParameterValue)
        Executes the given query that contains parameters (all strings). (Parameters must be represented as question marks which is Java limitation.)
        Parameters:
        con - - Connection to DB
        sQuery - - Query to execute
        sParameterValue - - Values to substitute for the parameters in order
        Returns:
        ResultSet

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.sql.Connection con,
                              java.lang.String sQuery,
                              java.lang.String[][] sParameterDetails)
        Executes the given query that contains parameters (any type). (Parameters must be represented as question marks which is Java limitation.)
        Parameters:
        con - - Connection to DB
        sQuery - - Query to execute
        sParameterDetails - - array that contains the value and type for each parameter ex. { {"1", "int"}, {"true", "boolean"}, {"something", ""} }
        Returns:
        ResultSet

      • updateQuery

        public boolean updateQuery(java.sql.Connection con,
                  java.lang.String sQuery,
                  java.lang.String[] sParameterValue)
        Executes query that updates the DB with all string parameters
        Parameters:
        con -
        sQuery - - SQL query with ? for the parameters to replace
        sParameterValue - - values of parameters in order
        Returns:
